titles.title: Evaluation of rehabilitation impact on hydraulic and environmental performance of sewer systems (WP3 CARE-S Project)

resource.publisher: DTU Library, Technical University of Denmark (DTU)

contributor.contributorName: Palermo University, Dipartimento di Ingegneria Idraulica ed Applicazioni Ambientali
Brno University of Technology (BUT), Institute of Municipal Water management
Technische Universit\303\244t Dresden, Institute for Urban Water Management

descriptions.description: The research project CARE-S (Computer Aided RE-habilitation of Sewer Networks) deals with public sewer and storm water networks of any dimension. CARE-S aims to analyse the structural and functional reliability of wastewater networks at minimum cost and disturbance. The ultimate product will be a Decision Support System (DSS) that will enable municipal engineers to establish and maintain effective management of their sewer networks. The project work plan follows a logical structure for the necessary work. It is divided in 10 Work Packages (WP) and each WP is distributed among several partners. The present paper presents the structure and the final results of WP 3 .The work package aim is the description of hydraulic and environmental performance of drainage systems both in the present condition and in possible future scenarios considering sewer system temporal decline and the application of feasible rehabilitation techniques.
